title: Book Review: ‘The Ruin of All Witches,’ by Malcolm Gaskill
description: “The Ruin of All Witches,” by Malcolm Gaskill, is a riveting history of life in a 17th-century New England frontier town, where the stress of isolation, foul weather, disease and death led inexorably to accusations of witchcraft.
dc:creator: Caroline Fraser
media:description: In 1651, decades before the famous Salem trials, the town of Springfield, Mass., was rocked by allegations of witchcraft.
